Every application is isolated from the document using Web Workers. This allows Grimwire to make decisions for its programs: how their responses should be interpreted, how they compose, how they share resources, and how they're kept secure.

Multi-threading comes by default. Applications can easily add more workers, and additional transports for messaging – including WebSockets and WebRTC – can integrate in future releases without changes to the userland.

Server-side-only doesn't mean dumb UIs. Grimwire provides a toolset for building rich real-time UIs without violating REST principles. As a result, most tools available to local servers are available to remote servers as well – the only difference is latency!
